column4: HELP, i'm in irssi, just installed dapper, tried to install my nvidia card, but.. the xorg.conf was showing a driver, but it wasnt 'nv' i changed it to nvidia..now all i got when loading X is my mouse pointer and a black screen, putting it back to nv does the same
will i have to reinstall ?
anybody knows  whats (and/or why) the (unknown) driver name after a dapper install with a geforce 2 ?
help ?
so anyone can help me then, guess i'll reinstall
What's the problem?
just finished installing dapper...tried to install my nvidia (gf2) , changed the driver name to nvidia (but it wasnt nv to start..) then, all is black when i log in X
you need to install the kernel module to go with it.  Google for nvidia kernel module and go from there.
You need to install the restricted modules and then enable it.
Apologies.
Do you have lynx or links availible?
Right ones for the right kernel?  There's borked dependancies for 23 up to 25.
cat /etc/modules, see if nvidia is in there.
well, i followed a online guide
nop, there's just 'lp' and 'psmouse'
nano /etc/modules
, same thing
In your case, you need to add nvidia to your modules file.
Nope, the kernel module allows direct access to the card.  Add the line nvidia, reboot and try again.
This is presuming that the restricted modules are installed (we'll assume for the min)
